companyProfile.companyDescription: MRF Limited is an India-based multinational tire maker. The Company is engaged in the manufacture of rubber products, such as tires, tubes, flaps, tread rubber. The Company's tires products include MRF PERFINZA, MRF MARKUS, MRF CITIBUS, MRF MOGRIP METEOR M TT, MRF ZAPPER TL, MRF ZAPPER N TL, MRF SUPER MILER 99 PLUS, MRF SUPER LUG FIFTY PLUS R, MRF SAVARI EXTRA, and others. The Company's international business has a range of tires in various categories, including heavy-duty truck/bus tires, light trucks, MUV/RCV/passenger cars, motorsports, farm services, military services, forklifts, two/three-wheeler, off-the-road/earthmovers, and pretreads. Its tires and services stocks the entire range of MRF tires and is equipped to provide services, such as computerized nitrogen inflation, tubeless repair, wheel alignment, wheel balancing and tire changing. The Company provides paints and coats, including water-based wood finishes, pigmented finishes, special coatings, and others.

recentNews.headline: MRF declares record date for payment of final dividend for FY25. Details here
recentNews.intro: MRF Limited announced a record date of July 18 for its final dividend of  ?229 per share for FY25. The payment will occur after August 18, 2025. MRF shares rose 1.9% following the announcement, reflecting a 13% gain over the past year.
recentNews.imagecaption: MRF declares record date for payment of  ?229 final dividend for FY25. Details here

recentNews.headline: Dassault Aviation, Lockheed Martin shares remain in focus as India eyes more fighter jets amid border threats
recentNews.intro: To enhance combat capabilities, India aims to induct new multirole fighter jets over the next few years, focusing on Lockheed Martin's F-21 and Dassault's Rafale. This move addresses the declining strength of the Indian Air Force amid regional tensions.
recentNews.imagecaption: Dassault Aviation, Lockheed Martin shares remain in focus as India eyes more fighter jets amid border threats

recentNews.headline: Lord Jagannath's chariot to roll on Sukhoi jet tires on Kolkata streets: Report
recentNews.intro: This year's Rath Yatra in Kolkata will feature a chariot on Sukhoi fighter jet tires, organized by ISCKON Kolkata. After 20 years of searching, MRF supplied the tires, which can bear a weight of 16 tonnes. A trial run was successfully conducted.

recentNews.headline: CEAT, MRF among 4 tyre stocks that zoomed up to 22% following Q4 numbers. Do you own any?
recentNews.intro: Ceat, JK Tyre, and MRF stocks have rallied following healthy March quarter results, prompting positive investor sentiment. Despite sluggish vehicle sales, strong replacement demand boosted growth.
recentNews.imagecaption: CEAT, MRF among 4 tyre stocks that zoomed up to 22% following Q4 numbers. Do you own any?

recentNews.headline: Maruti, Eicher to MRF: 6 auto stocks near record highs after strong rally. Do you own any?
recentNews.intro: Auto stocks, including Maruti Suzuki and MRF, are nearing record highs after a sustained upward trend. MRF is just 1% below its peak, while Mahindra & Mahindra and TVS Motor Company are also close to their all-time highs, driven by improved market sentiment and economic recovery expectations.
recentNews.imagecaption: From Maruti to MRF, 6 auto stocks near record highs after strong rally. Do you own any?

recentNews.headline: Virat Kohli retires from Test cricket: From MRF Tyres to Boost, a look at Indian cricket star's brand endorsements
recentNews.intro: Apart from being the most sought-after cricketer of current times, Virat Kohli is also the most popular face for many top brands, which want to make him their brand ambassador. Here's a list.
recentNews.imagecaption: File: India's Virat Kohli walks out before the start of play on the second day of the fourth cricket test between Australia and India at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, Melbourne, Australia, Friday, Dec. 27, 2024. (AP Photo/Asanka Brendon Ratnayake)

recentNews.headline: MRF Q4 Results: Tyre manufacturer announces 2,290% dividend of  ?229; PAT rises 31% YoY. Check details
recentNews.intro: MRF Dividend: MRF on Wednesday, May 7, announced a whopping 2290% dividend payout for its investors along with its fourth quarter results for the financial year ended 2024-25 (Q4 FY25). MRF board approved the final dividend of  ?229 per share of face value of  ?10 each.
recentNews.imagecaption: MRF Dividend: Tyre manufacturer announces 2,290% dividend of  ?229 apiece. Check details

recentNews.headline: Q4 results today: Coal India, Punjab National Bank, Dabur, MRF, United Breweries, Blue Star, Voltas, more on May 7
recentNews.intro: Coal India, Punjab National Bank, Dabur, MRF, United Breweries, Blue Star, and Voltas are among 52 companies that are set to announce their Q4FY25 earnings reports today, on May 7.
recentNews.imagecaption: Coal India, Punjab National Bank, Dabur, MRF, United Breweries, Blue Star, and Voltas are among 52 companies that are set to announce their Q4FY25 earnings reports today, on May 7.
